column1: 4 0 0 Hey. EOS 4 1 1 [Question] Hello! How are you doing today? EOS 4 0 2 I' m doing alright, trying to stay cheerful. EOS 4 1 3 [Others] That' s great, especially around this time of the Holidays. EOS 4 0 4 Yeah, it is good because of the holidays. EOS 4 1 5 [Question] So, how are things in your life? EOS 4 0 6 Not to bad, just had a death in the family. Pretty bummed about it because we are a close to our extended family and can' t visit one another to grieve. EOS 4 1 7 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I' m very sorry to hear that. Not being able to be with family when something like that happens is incredibly difficult, those are the people you want to be around the most.

0 0 0 Hi. I' m a little stressed out at the moment over losing my job in the coming months. EOS 0 1 1 [Reflection of feelings] I' m sorry to hear about that! I can totally understand why you' d be stressed.. Is it for certain that you will lose your job? EOS 0 0 2 The company I work for is winding down. i' m on the old side to be looking for a job and i' m likely going to have to accept a lower salary, a longer commute and a heavier workload. In other words, I have a job I love, close to where I live that is very manageable. I can' t sleep and I' m insanely anxious all of the time. EOS 0 1 3 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I can feel your anxiety, and I completely understand why you' re feeling that way, but you don' t know for sure that will be true. Have you started looking for a new job already? EOS 0 0 4 I started looking for a job last week. I had a transition meeting today to pass on the little bit of my work that will be left to another person. I have 2 children; one who just started college this fall and another who is a junior in high school. my elderly mother lives with me also so I can' t sell my house any time soon and move into something smaller and cheaper. I feel really trapped at the moment.. EOS 0 1 5 [Providing Suggestions or Information] It definitely sounds like you' re being overwhelmed with a lot of responsibilities along with your job loss. It' s definitely a lot of things to deal with all at once, but it would help to break things down so they' re more manageable. Do you have anyone close by who can help you out? EOS 0 0 6 i have friends and family close by. i don' t like to burden people with my problems. I know i also don' t adjust well to change and that doesn' t help. breaking issues down into groups is helpful and may take away some of the enormity of everything. EOS 0 1 7 [Self-disclosure] I understand completely. I used to bottle things up too, but I' ve learned that the people who love you won' t think you' re a burden if you ask for help or just to have someone blow off some steam. Changes are definitely scary, but they can also be a great opportunity to do something different. Is there anything you want to try doing? EOS 0 0 8 I' ve always been reluctant to ask for help or favors because i keep thinking there will always be a time down the road where i will need something more. it' s helpful to have someone remind me that change isn' t always a bad thing. thank you. I' ll talk to some friends to see if anyone has some good budget cutting tricks. I' ll continue to look for a job and i' ll try to calm down a little for now. EOS 0 1 9 [Affirmation and Reassurance] It sounds like you' re very self - aware and I think your friends and family will be very willing to lend a hand. EOS 0 0 10 i am aware of many things including how truly fortunate i am to have my family, friends and health. I really appreciate your kind words and calming suggestions. thank you again. EOS 0 1 11 [Greeting] Yes, your family, friends, and health are all really important! I hope you stay safe! EOS 0 0 12 You too. EOS 0 1 13 [Greeting] I hope you get to enjoy the coming holidays with your family and friends! EOS 0 0 14 and you as well. EOS 0 1 15 [Greeting] You' re welcome! Have a great day.. EOS 0 0 16 Have a great day too! EOS 0 1 17 [Self-disclosure] I hope I was able to help.
3 0 0 hi, I' m in depression because my kids not listen to me. EOS 3 1 1 [Providing Suggestions or Information] just stay calm.

0 1 0 [Question] Hi! How are you feeling today? EOS 0 0 1 i was sad to today. my partner cheating with me. EOS 0 1 2 [Question] Can you tell me a little about what happened? Oh No! I can understand why you would be sad. EOS 0 0 3 today both are check to my company account there are lot of money different to my company account. hello are you there. EOS 0 1 4 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] It sounds like you found out because you saw strange charges on your account. Is that right? EOS 0 0 5 yes, is that right. EOS 0 1 6 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Sometimes bringing this up with your partner can help you feel better. Have you tried this? EOS 0 0 7 yes lot of time i will favor to my partner. EOS 0 1 8 [Self-disclosure] I' ve been in a similar situation before. It helped me to talk about it.

3 0 0 I feel sad. EOS 3 1 1 [Question] I am sorry to hear that. Do you want to tell me more about what is going on? EOS 3 0 2 im mad at myself for trusting him again. EOS 3 1 3 [Question] What happened? EOS 3 0 4 he cheated on me. EOS 3 1 5 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I am so sorry about that. I would be sad and mad too. EOS 3 0 6 he ghosted and he was trying to get with other girsl on tinder. i wish he had the balls to actually do a proper break up he promised me he would never do that but ofcourse he lied. EOS 3 1 7 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I can understand how upset that must be. EOS 3 0 8 I know. why did he lied. EOS 3 1 9 [Question] That' s an answer we might never know. What' s something that would make you feel better? EOS 3 0 10 I should of left when he made my white coat ceromony after him after I worked my tail off for 3 yearts for it. im not really sure. i wish i can forget he exsisted. EOS 3 1 11 [Affirmation and Reassurance] That has to be frustrating. It sounds like you are angry. How long ago did all of this happen?

2 0 0 Hi there, I really need someone to talk to right now. EOS 2 1 1 [Question] Hi there! I am here to chat:) What is on your mind? EOS 2 0 2 My partner ran off with another woman and I simply cannot get over it. Why did he do this to me? EOS 2 1 3 [Reflection of feelings] I' m so sorry to hear that, that is really rough. He sounds like a real jerk if you ask me!.

3 1 0 [Question] Hi, what I can help you with today? EOS 3 0 1 Hi. I had problems in the past and somehow right now. EOS 3 1 2 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] What sort of problems were in your past and now? EOS 3 0 3 I loved physics and I decided to attend university, but soon after I slowly lost my interest and became unmotivated. EOS 3 1 4 [Question] What was happening in your life that made you lose interest? EOS 3 0 5 Actually the professors and the class atmosphere was the reason, and of course the quality of teaching. so I started to skipping the classes and failing. EOS 3 1 6 [Reflection of feelings] It sounds like that is a lot of reasons to be stressed. Have you spoken to a school counselor? EOS 3 0 7 Yes lots of stress and pressure. I did not, because we didn' t have such things or at least I wasn' t aware. But nobody even pointed that why I' m failing, they just didn' t care. EOS 3 1 8 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I agree it is a lot of pressure, but do not let bad teachers deter you. I would reach out to a school counselor and let them know your situation. Every school must have one. Also, physics is a difficult course to study, but if you chose it, that means you have a very strong mind. EOS 3 0 9 I loved physics a lot more than now, but what' s the point of studying when the teachers are pulsing you not to study!( because of the quality of teaching) I hope there was someone, but I don' t think we have a counselor. EOS 3 1 10 [Affirmation and Reassurance] More reason to speak to a school counselor or school administrator. We need to provide help to students, not have bad teachers deter them. EOS 3 0 11 Yeah, same with me! I wish I could attend a better univeristy. EOS 3 1 12 [Question] What made you choose this particular university you are at? EOS 3 0 13 I didn' t have another choice but this. EOS 3 1 14 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Have you looked into other Universities for the possibility of transferring.

3 0 0 hi.. How are you today. EOS 3 1 1 [Question] Hello, I' m fine thank you how are you? EOS 3 0 2 Iam facing little depression because of discontinuing my academics. EOS 3 1 3 [Question] I see, when did you stop academics? EOS 3 0 4 Last year. I got married and my husbands family is not accepting to get me proceed with my masters degree. Iam very depressed about that.. EOS 3 1 5 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] so if I understand you correctly, you cannot continue your studies because your in - laws don' t want you to? EOS 3 0 6 yes.. and iam finding it difficult to cope with that.. EOS 3 1 7 [Self-disclosure] That sounds very disappointing, I can understand why you are feeling down about this. I had to stop university halfway through for health reasons, and was not able to go back, I found that depressing too. EOS 3 0 8 How did you manage to get out of the depression.. If you dont mind, can you tell me what happened? EOS 3 1 9 [Affirmation and Reassurance] it is hard to let go of a dream. it' s normal to feel down about it. EOS 3 0 10 Can you suggest some remedies of how to get out of depression.. EOS 3 1 11 [Self-disclosure] I have mental health issues so I could not continue my studies, sadly. I take antidepressants and have a counselor. is there anyone you can talk to about your depresion, perhaps your doctor? EOS 3 0 12 Oh I cannot go to counsellor because of they are too expensive.. I want to talk about it to some one but even my parents are not very supportive of me.. EOS 3 1 13 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Are you in a city? Some cities have free counselors. oh dear that is hard when your family is not behind you. EOS 3 0 14 Yes iam in a city.. I dont know about any free counsellors.. How to find the info. EOS 3 1 15 [Providing Suggestions or Information] are you near a public library? sometimes librarians are really helpful to find community information. you could call them. do you have a family doctor? EOS 3 0 16 Oh I think we have a public library near to my houe.. I can enquire about it. EOS 3 1 17 [Providing Suggestions or Information] or of course you could do a google search for counseling. EOS 3 0 18 sure.. I can do that.. thank you for your help.. EOS 3 1 19 [Providing Suggestions or Information] it sounds like what you are going through is a grieving proces. it' s the loss of a dream that was very important to you. it will get easier over time. EOS 3 0 20 I really hope so that i will be happy with my life.. EOS 3 1 21 [Question] i hope you can go back to academics in the future, do you think that will be possible? EOS 3 0 22 Its not in my hands, my family should approve. But I will be positive about this.. That is the only option i have left.. EOS 3 1 23 [Question] i see, may I ask where you are from?

4 1 0 [Question] Hello there, how are you feeling at the moment? EOS 4 0 1 Well, not totally terrible, but sad.. EOS 4 1 2 [Question] I am sorry to hear that but I am happy to listen. What would you like to talk about? EOS 4 0 3 I used to be really driven to succeed at things. After I graduated college and tried jobs that lasted 1 - 2 years each at most before I was fired, I gave up believing in most of my abilities to succeed in the workforce. EOS 4 1 4 [Question] Okay, well, let' s take this one thing at a time. What would you say the main reason you were fired was? EOS 4 0 5 Now, even during the pandemic, I have no drive to re - enter the workforce and my family thankfully isn' t pushing me to get a job, but I often doubt my self worth because I haven' t felt successful at long term goals in a few years. EOS 4 1 6 [Self-disclosure] I understand how it feels to feel you are not doing as well as you might. I work in the gig economy and enjoy it but it' s not what I' d intended to do with my life. EOS 4 0 7 Well, the last company I worked at, we were all fired.... because the landlord raised the rent so hire on my boss the owner, he couldn' t afford to stay there, pre - pandemic. EOS 4 1 8 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Hmph that does not sound at all cool but it can hardly be considered your fault. EOS 4 0 9 In fact most of the jobs I' ve had, the companies have been sold. In retrospect it' s easy for me to realize I should have gone to more stable companies that weren' t eventually sold. Also I suffer from what Google seems to call imposter syndrome. EOS 4 1 10 [Providing Suggestions or Information] It' s a very unstable time unfortunately - even highly reputable companies seem to be in trouble. Ah I have heard of that. You do not think that you are good enough? EOS 4 0 11 Well, I haven' t felt the desire I used to feel before the pandemic to go get a new job because I felt burned out working in retail for minimum wage. EOS 4 1 12 [Question] I hear you. It' s a demoralising sector to work in, for sure. What would you like to do, if you had your choice? EOS 4 0 13 I used to do a lot of charity work as a side hobby to help other people, and sadly, the pandemic kind of spotlit how many of us are struggling and broke, so it didn' t exactly feel proper asking to help other peopole in wheelchairs like myself who I' d raise money for to go to adaptive summer camp( kids and adults) - this' ll be the 2nd summer in a row where camp is virtual. I never wanted to be paid for that charity work btw. EOS 4 1 14 [Others] I know that:) You seem like a good person. I think that the pandemic has had a negative impact on virtually everyone. It' s been a very strange 15 months, for sure.

2 1 0 [Question] hi. EOS 2 0 1 hello. EOS 2 1 2 [Question] how may I help you. EOS 2 0 3 i have this course that freaks me out. EOS 2 1 4 [Question] okay. EOS 2 0 5 its calculus and i dint seems to get it. EOS 2 1 6 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] yes the course is kind difficult. have you try to tell your friends or someone to put you through? EOS 2 0 7 i did have a friend that put me trough but still couldn' t get it right. EOS 2 1 8 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I know that you have done your best, but keep on trying more ways by telling someone. I know that you have done your best, but keep on trying more ways by telling someone. EOS 2 0 9 how can i go about it if i don' t get what i am being thought. EOS 2 1 10 [Reflection of feelings] I can see how anxious you are, just as i am chatting with you. You really need assistance to solve the course and pass very well. I was also in that shoe, but you can try to move close to someone you think knows the course very well. EOS 2 0 11 yes i am very anxious and scared. EOS 2 1 12 [Affirmation and Reassurance] you have done best so far, you need to get rid of that fear to understand the course. You can even go online, like download some videos about the course, it will tutor you and really be of help. hello. EOS 2 0 13 yes i will try and download some video tutorial on youtube maybe that will help. EOS 2 1 14 [Others] definitely, it will be of help. EOS 2 0 15 ok thanks for the advice. EOS 2 1 16 [Affirmation and Reassurance] get your courage back, do not give room for fear.. you are welcome, EOS 2 0 17 yea, will try and do that. EOS 2 1 18 [Self-disclosure] I wish you the best luck. EOS 2 0 19 thanks pal. EOS 2 1 20 [Self-disclosure] bye. you can end the chat.

4 0 0 Hello. EOS 4 1 1 [Greeting] Good afternoon. How are you doing today? EOS 4 0 2 I' ve been better. EOS 4 1 3 [Question] Sounds like you might be having a rough day. Is there something specific on your mind? EOS 4 0 4 I' ve seen an increase in expenses recently and need to find a new job, however I really enjoy what I do. I' m just feeling very sad about it. EOS 4 1 5 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] An uptick in expenses seems to be an issue for a lot of us right now. Glad to hear you enjoy your job. Sounds like you are a bit torn about leaving a great company. Do I understand that right? EOS 4 0 6 That' s right. It' s hard to know what to do. EOS 4 1 7 [Reflection of feelings] I can absolutely understand why your situation is difficult. Have you had a chance to talk with your manager about another opportunity within the company that provides higher compensation?

1 1 0 [Question] Hello how can I help you? EOS 1 0 1 Kind of mad.. EOS 1 1 2 [Question] May I ask the reason why you are mad? EOS 1 0 3 My friends got me banned on Playstation. People I' ve known for 4 years. EOS 1 1 4 [Question] were their actions accidental or intentional? EOS 1 0 5 Intentional. First it started from one person cuz my friend put me on speaker about something. and apparently I said something that made one person mad. I was on a PHONE CALL. EOS 1 1 6 [Question] Did you say anything offensive? EOS 1 0 7 Kind of. My friend asked what is up and my girlfriend of course was nosey and said bad cuz my mom is harassing us. I was saying my mom has been ripping me off and keeps threatening to kick me out.. So I just said. I honestly am at the point where I don' t care if she is around or not. So someone reported me for some bs thing on playstation cuz they think I must be trash if I don' t love my mom or something. EOS 1 1 8 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I see. If that is the case, create a personal meeting with you and your friends( the ones who banned you). EOS 1 0 9 My mom is kind of a draining person. I thought of being around because she has been going through low hemoglobin. But she keeps ruining my life. I wish I could. I don' t even know the jerk. The rest of them then did it because they don' t like my girlfriend. EOS 1 1 10 [Question] just to clarify, are these online friends? Have you met them in person? EOS 1 0 11 Online friends. I only know one. the one who was on the phone with me. he just can' t keep a call private for anything. EOS 1 1 12 [Question] and now for that one friend, does he know the other friends personally? EOS 1 0 13 Even my nephew who plays with those jerks was avoiding me because my girlfriend.. yeah... So... my girlfriend has this condition and was in a hospital for high contamination in her blood from her bad liver. So she was talking weird. and everyone was calling her annoying. EOS 1 1 14 [Others] I' m sorry to hear that. EOS 1 0 15 But those insensentive morons don' t care she literally almost died. Instead, everyone just keeps asking why am I with this disabled girl. Like... she is better now. She just needed to recover. People I knew for four years... going out of their way to mess with me. EOS 1 1 16 [Providing Suggestions or Information] The best advice I can give you is to try to get your friends together on a private group call. Then tell them that what they' ve heard was a complete misunderstanding. And tell them to unban you from playstation. However, if they do not respect your response, then they can' t really be relied on as your friends. They don' t come to respect you so it is best for you to move on. EOS 1 0 17 Yeah. I mostly tried to stay to my myself.. Right now they' re mad at me because they got all warnings from Sony. since they did an investigation on how everyone speaks. EOS 1 1 18 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Nobody should demoralize another person and that is what your" online friends" are taking advantage of. EOS 1 0 19 Even my own sister is giving me crap because my nephew almost lost thousands worth of games. EOS 1 1 20 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Also send a report to Sony about the ban. I believe with the proof, they can appeal the ban for you! EOS 1 0 21 cuz of the warning... Like I can control what these people do when I' m offline.. I did... they said they can' t do anything. and that I can just report them. Kind of sucks but I guess I will just stick my lane. Karma already banned someone in the group. took$ 2000 worth of games. so that gave me a good laugh. EOS 1 1 22 [Providing Suggestions or Information] In that case just keep reporting them..

1 0 0 I' m looking for support in regards to a recent break up. My boyfriend/ fiance seems to be a serial and or chronic masturbator. When I looked at his files in his computer it was shocking! Are you there? I am seeking some support in this crazy world? The thing is that his files contained really gross porn and live webcam sites. What should I do? When I confronted him he said it was not him! He lied so horribly! I am heartbroken. I also found out that he has had many different profiles on facebook that are just covert operations. What would you think? Please tell me what advice you would give? His spam folder is full of crap! all of it like Fuck me here and now! Hello there are you there? EOS 1 1 1 [Others] sorry i' m here. EOS 1 0 2 I have checked his email folders and we have talked about his over the top usage of porn and online dating sites. He has admitted that he is in fact a sex addict! Should I hold on or should I let it go? Just find someone else that I can actually trust? EOS 1 1 3 [Question] First of all, I have a fre questions to ask. Does the idea of him being sex addict change how you feel about him? EOS 1 0 4 What' s the fre question? what is fre? Not necessarily. Just the trust issue really. EOS 1 1 5 [Others] I would say you should cut tie with him. Being into porn is a serious issue but what' s more important is he lied to you about that. EOS 1 0 6 We' ve known each other for years and have been friends for a very long time.. We dated on and off and things just seem to always go back to this weird off place.. EOS 1 1 7 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I think you can also feel it yourself that there' s something not right between you and him. EOS 1 0 8 I appreciate your thoughts. So you don' t think I should give him another chance?. EOS 1 1 9 [Affirmation and Reassurance] This is a wake up call for you I must say, to get away from him. I think you should sit down and tell him to take a break, this doesn' t mean completely break up but some time for both of you to think it over. EOS 1 0 10 I feel like I really can' t trust him and find myself looking through his computer and phone questioning things. makes me feel crazy. EOS 1 1 11 [Reflection of feelings] I understand how you feel, it' s not easy to get over this feeling. EOS 1 0 12 Is this a clean site or do people use it for porn chat? EOS 1 1 13 [Others] That' s why you need some time for yourself to think whether you can forgive him and try to help him or not. EOS 1 0 14 I know. That sounds like great advice. Hard to pull off during the pandemic though. EOS 1 1 15 [Self-disclosure] To be honest, watching porn is normal, however, I feel that if someone is too into it, as in watch it more than 1 - 2 times a month, it' s problematic and won' t be easy to fix. Do you live with him? EOS 1 0 16 Ah. I think it' s more of a real issue when it comes to controlling himself or using sites because he was single for so long. He is currently staying with me. EOS 1 1 17 [Providing Suggestions or Information] You can ask him to stop doing that for you, if he really cares, he will try.

3 1 0 [Greeting] Hello there. EOS 3 0 1 Hello. EOS 3 1 2 [Question] Is there something you want to discuss? EOS 3 0 3 yes. My birthday' s coming up and I feel a lot of self - hatred for what I' ve failed to accomplish by this age. EOS 3 1 4 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] So it sounds like the birthday is a time for self - reflection, and you' re not happy with where you are right now? EOS 3 0 5 yea that' s right. It' s weighing heavy on my mind at the moment. EOS 3 1 6 [Question] Is this something you' ve felt on previous birthdays? EOS 3 0 7 yes, the older I get the worse the feeling is. I didn' t used to hate birthdays when I was younger. EOS 3 1 8 [Self-disclosure] I' ll confess I have felt the same way, especially with" milestone" birthdays( 30, 40, 50, etc.). Do you think you are possibly expect too much in terms of achievements? EOS 3 0 9 Yes, those are hard. My 30th was difficult. Society has so many wrong ideas of where people need to be, and it just doesn' t apply to me. I' m so different from normal people. maybe, but being autistic, even average achievements are hard for me. I have to work so hard just to be average. May I ask, how did you deal with your own birthday depression? Maybe I can learn from you. EOS 3 1 10 [Self-disclosure] As I became older, i started to wonder what terms like" normal people" and being" average" really mean. Am I comparing myself to something that even exists?

4 0 0 Hey. EOS 4 1 1 [Question] Hello! How are you doing today? EOS 4 0 2 I' m doing alright, trying to stay cheerful. EOS 4 1 3 [Others] That' s great, especially around this time of the Holidays. EOS 4 0 4 Yeah, it is good because of the holidays. EOS 4 1 5 [Question] So, how are things in your life? EOS 4 0 6 Not to bad, just had a death in the family. Pretty bummed about it because we are a close to our extended family and can' t visit one another to grieve. EOS 4 1 7 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I' m very sorry to hear that. Not being able to be with family when something like that happens is incredibly difficult, those are the people you want to be around the most. EOS 4 0 8 Yeah, we just had a virtual funeral for him and it was painful to watch. We couldn' t console those who needed it. EOS 4 1 9 [Self-disclosure] I actually had a death in a family a few months ago as well, with a virtual funeral. I really empathize with the way you and your family are feeling. But you know, I tried to look at the virtual funeral as a way for so many people to pay tribute in a way they couldn' t in person. People from all over ge t their chance to say goodbye. EOS 4 0 10 Yeah thats a good way to look at it, the whole family was able to get together in one place and was able participate safely. We also chatted hours afterwards. I did feel better about it. EOS 4 1 11 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Truly, everyone got to participate and pay tribute together. Virtually or not, you were all together. EOS 4 0 12 Yes it is, I do wish we can meet in person but COVID. I do feel better though, this was the best case scenario. Got to meet everyone and say my goodbyes at least. EOS 4 1 13 [Affirmation and Reassurance] That' s a great way to look at it. In a year where COVID had gotten in the way of so many plans, I think it' s really great to try and extract the best experience we can. EOS 4 0 14 Yeah try to stay safe together and reduce the spread of this diseases. EOS 4 1 15 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Exactly, trying to be safe together to keep everyone else safe. Looking out for one another is something this year has made really important.

4 0 0 hello. EOS 4 1 1 [Question] Hi there. How are you doing? EOS 4 0 2 ok. not great. how r u. EOS 4 1 3 [Question] I am sorry to hear that. What is going on that makes you not feel great? I am well, thanks for asking. EOS 4 0 4 breaking up with husband. mixed emotions on it. relieved it is out in the open, sad it has to be over. EOS 4 1 5 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Going through a break up is never easy, especially when it is with someone you thought you would spend you life with. I understand completely. It is natural to feel sad for a while. I have been divorced myself so I know it is not easy. But I can promise it gets much better. EOS 4 0 6 yeah. it sucks. wish it was not this way. do not want to move on but without trust there is nothing. EOS 4 1 7 [Reflection of feelings] Of course and it is normal to have mixed feelings. EOS 4 0 8 I just cannot get out of this funk. why me? what did i do to make him want someone else? EOS 4 1 9 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Have you looked into any divorce support groups in your area or online? It can help to discover that you are not alone in how you feel. EOS 4 0 10 Yeah, but the only one in my area in person is cancelled. online seems impersonal. I dont mind being on my own, but like companionship. But will not trust again. I am in a no win situation. At least the kids are grown. talking does help some, just no way to fix this really. It is internalized with me. EOS 4 1 11 [Self-disclosure] I understand. I went though a lot of feelings myself when I divorced. Blaming myself, blaming him, missing him. It took some time to work through but thankfully today it is all a distant memory. Sometimes time is the best healer. Be kind to yourself and take time for you. EOS 4 0 12 yep. i guess it is too soon. 2020 is the suckiest year ever. On so many levels. EOS 4 1 13 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I hear you on that. It has been a very unusual year in general. I think that with everything going on in the world it is more important than ever that we take me time. EOS 4 0 14 got plenty of me time. lol. this is just the worst year to meet people. most of my friends were mutual marriage friends, and their pity is uncomfortable, and a few have chosen sides. EOS 4 1 15 [Self-disclosure] I know how hurtful that can be when people chose sides. It happened in my own divorce. The best thing you can do I think is to remember not to let anyone else' s misinformed opinions affect how you ultimately view yourself. None of those people were there and none of them experienced what you did. EOS 4 0 16 yeah, i am ok with losing certain friends. some have surprised me some not so much. no way to meet new people or get away.. EOS 4 1 17 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I understand, it is a difficult time to meet new people. Even in normal times a divorce is difficult but even more so with the restrictions we have at the moment. I think everything you are feeling is normal. Have you connected with a therapist to help you process all of your feelings. I know that helped me. Many are doing virtual sessions at the moment.
0 1 0 [Question] Good afternoon! How are you doing today?

2 1 0 [Reflection of feelings] hello. hello how are you? EOS 2 0 1 hey there. hello. good, and you_ cannot type today, sorry. Too much typing today. EOS 2 1 2 [Question] I am doing well. That is okay typing can be a bit of a pain. Is there anyway i could convince you to type a little longer so that I may help you? I assure you that your typing skills are above par& I know you will knock it out of the park my friend! EOS 2 0 3 great. haha,. EOS 2 1 4 [Greeting] Awesome i am glad to have you back! EOS 2 0 5 thanks. I always have a second thought when I type. It makes my typing speed slow as well. EOS 2 1 6 [Question] You are very welcome& why do have second thoughts when you type? The only thing that matters is that you made the effort to type reguardless of how well you feel your typing skills are. You should be proud of uourself! I myself use to struggle with typing. Do you think maybe you are being to hard on yourself? EOS 2 0 7 great advise, I think so. I am sometimes hard on myself. I think sometimes my head gets confused. I wish I could have more clear mind. 6 0 0 Hello. EOS 6 1 1 [Greeting] Hello! How are you doing today?. EOS 6 0 2 I' m not doing very well unfortunately. I failed my college finals, and now I' m up for Academic Probation. EOS 6 1 3 [Question] I am so sorry to hear that, I' d love to understand more about what you are struggling with? EOS 6 0 4 I' m almost near gradution too. EOS 6 1 5 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Oh no! I am so sorry to hear that. Academic probation does seem very scary. When did you learn you failed your finals? EOS 6 0 6 I learned yesterday. Because of the pandemic the semester is shorter. EOS 6 1 7 [Question] And how long do you have until graduation? EOS 6 0 8 I should be graduating in June. EOS 6 1 9 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I see. Well it' s nice that we matched up! I actually work at a college and now a couple good strategies to get off academic probation, and or avoid it! What is it you are studying? EOS 6 0 10 You' re a great resource then! I am majoring in Psychology with a minor in Biology. EOS 6 1 11 [Others] Oh that is awesome! So when do you find out whether or not you are on probation?. EOS 6 0 12 Likely in the next week. I registered for my classes for next semester but I think I should drop my minor.\ EOS 6 1 13 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can' t overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health. I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation. EOS 6 0 14 That' s great advice and likely would be my best option. I will definitely do that. I feel better hearing that it' s okay to drop my minor. I felt like a failure when I considered it. EOS 6 1 17 [Affirmation and Reassurance] You are definitely not a failure in the slightest! In fact, I would argue that you are the exact opposite of that. It is tough, but I just want to finally finish my Bachelor' s and do something positive. EOS 6 1 19 [Affirmation and Reassurance] And you will succeed in that goal. You have the motivation and the care for it, you just need to focus on managing everything at once! Have you thought about meeting with an academic advisor and laying out a plan?

EOS 3 0 8 I' ve learned that mines not really an emotional thing. I feel like my sleeping issue causes my depression. Because no matter what - i always feel exhausted. It was very helpful for a while there. EOS 3 1 9 [Affirmation and Reassurance] If I didn' t get good rest, then I would definitely feel tired the next day and over time, it would wear me out. I believe medication will help with the symptoms, but it is important to get the root of the problem, why exactly you find it difficult to sleep. Sometimes I take a benydryl because they always make me sleepy, but I usually know why I need to relax, I' m nervous about the next day. So I have found it important to know WHY I don' t rest well, if that makes sense to you. EOS 3 0 10 I plan on seeing a sleep doctor soon! Sometimes I lose sight of fixing the issue and need to be reminded. And yes!! I was treating my sleeping with Benadryl as well but it wasn' t healthy to keep doing that. EOS 3 1 11 [Others] I' m also thinking there are a few practical ways you can help yourself sleep. I was advised to get soft sheets, make my sleeping area more restful, make sure the time before bed is relaxing and calming. I also was helped a lot by a Christian Preacher, he' s long dead, but he has audio on youtube - - Frank Hammond, Pigs in the Parlor. It' s a 5 part series I found helpful, you might want to jot that down. And I do encourage you to find a counselor, once you rule out the physical( doctor) then you can look at emotional, mental and/ or spiritual. I think most of everything is spiritual and emotional to some degree, and our body just responds to that..

0 0 0 Hello.. I am so worried about losing my job. EOS 0 1 1 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Hello! How are you today? You are feeling anxious about the future? EOS 0 0 2 I am doing so - so. I just found out that my company was going to be using the new round of the paycheck protection from the stimulus to pay us. Now that didn' t get afford and I think we will be laid off on Monday. EOS 0 1 3 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Ok. You are making some assumptions on information you have about your company. Remember that you may not know the whole story. I, too, have made assumptions that affection my outlook and caused anxiety. My assumptions were often wrong. EOS 0 0 4 Well they sent out a email letting us know of the situation. SO I am also sure it is going to happen. I' m not sure how to let my family know. EOS 0 1 5 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Ok. Have you thought about a plan? When you tell your family, it may help to state your planned actions. This may help with feelings of uncertainty, both theirs and yours. When I have been in a similar situation, I started reaching out to my network of friends and coworkers before I was let go. EOS 0 0 6 Yea I just hate to do it today or tomorrow with it being Christmas. We do have a saving so that is good. But it will only last about 2 months. EOS 0 1 7 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I know. This is the worst time of year for this news. Surprisingly, it happens very often. Having 2 months of savings is FANTASTIC! More than most people. EOS 0 0 8 Yea. We have been saving snice the start of Covid. I knew this day would come it just hard at this time. EOS 0 1 9 [Question] Do you anticipate any roadblocks to finding new employment in your industry? I understand your feelings. The holidays are a joyous time. No place for uncertainty. EOS 0 0 10 In my area yes. I can find some in bigger cities but I don' t want to move. Yes Christmas is my families favorite time for sure. EOS 0 1 11 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Do you think that outlining a plan of action, and sharing that with your family will help turn this around a bit? Perhaps, think about as looking forward to a better opportunity in your future? EOS 0 0 12 Yes I am thinking on Sunday would be good and maybe by gods help we will have a stimulus deal. EOS 0 1 13 [Providing Suggestions or Information] The stimulus has helped a lot of people get through this tough time. Sounds like you will feel much more secure knowing that you will have some income, and not have to use your savings that you worked so hard for.

1 1 0 [Greeting] Hello, how are you doing today? EOS 1 0 1 I' m sad and angry because I no longer talk to my best friend. EOS 1 1 2 [Question] Do you know what might have happened to cause your and your best friend to not talk anymore? EOS 1 0 3 Well she was staying at my house for a month and we were constantly fighting so she just stopped talking to me. EOS 1 1 4 [Reflection of feelings] That sounds really stressful and I can see how troubling that is for you. EOS 1 0 5 Yes it is and then she began avoiding me while we were in the same house, so we started arguing again and I found out she' s been lying to me since I' ve known her and I' m very upset. EOS 1 1 6 [Self-disclosure] That' s definitely very upsetting. I know how it feels to have that sense of betrayal from a friend I was close to for many years. However, I was able to discuss the issue I had with my parents and other friends. Do you have anyone else close to you that you can talk to? EOS 1 0 7 I don' t think so, my parents think I was too harsh by deciding to end the friendship, it as if my own family doesn' t understand. EOS 1 1 8 [Providing Suggestions or Information] That can definitely add to frustration. What about your other friends? Do you have anyone who either shares the same opinion as you or does not know your friend that you can talk to? EOS 1 0 9 My other friend believed that it wasn' t too harsh to end the friendship as they know I value honesty but it makes me feel angry that I was being used for so long and constantly lied to. EOS 1 1 10 [Providing Suggestions or Information] You have every right to be angry, but the most important thing you can do is find a good support system with your other friend. It will take some time to heal, but I' ll tell you a paraphrased version of one of my favorite quotes:" Resentment is like swallowing poison and expecting the other person to die." It' s important to find support in your other friends and heal properly. EOS 1 0 11 I really love that quote, it' s absolutely true; I think I will talk to my friend about the situation some more so I can fully get over it. EOS 1 1 12 [Others] That sounds like a wonderful idea. Is there anything else you would like to discuss? EOS 1 0 13 Yes, I also realized that I wasn' t angry with my friend but rather myself. EOS 1 1 14 [Question] Can you elaborate more? Earlier you said you and your friend were arguing while she was living in your house, then she stopped talking to you. Why might you be angry with yourself? EOS 1 0 15 Because I basically allowed her to use me for seven years and kept lying to me or gave her space because I thought I was being a good friend. I feel like I was stupid to do that and soft. EOS 1 1 16 [Affirmation and Reassurance] If I may, I would argue that your actions don' t make you soft and they certainly don' t make you stupid. They are certainly not any reason to be angry with yourself. If I may bring up another clich:" Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me." I would say you' re in the" fool me once" stage and it is your friend' s actions that have brought you pain. I think you' re unlikely to trust her again. Also, hindsight is 20/ 20. What you might see now in ways that your friend might have used you are things that you might not have seen then. We want to think the best of our friends until they prove us wrong. I think you were being the best friend you could be. EOS 1 0 17 Thank you very much, I' ll continue to talk about the issue with my other friend, I really appreciate your wisdom.. EOS 1 1 18 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Of course. I think you' ll be alright and remember the healing process can take a long time after betrayal. Remember to be kind to yourself and keep that support system of your other friend by you. Is there anything else you would like to discuss?

0 0 0 Hello. EOS 0 1 1 [Question] Hello, how are you doing? EOS 0 0 2 I have been better. I am really stressed and feel like I am at a breaking point.. EOS 0 1 3 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] I am sorry to hear you are near your breaking point, do you have any idea when the decline and stress began? EOS 0 0 4 It began a few weeks ago. I have had a really intense project that is on a time crunch. I feel like I am overwhelmed and unable to balance work and personal life. EOS 0 1 5 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Work and personal life are very hard to juggle with each other, especially in the current life situations around the globe. I am sure you will successfully handle both in the overall. EOS 0 0 6 What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up. EOS 0 1 7 [Self-disclosure] For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to" debrief" my mind, and" declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue. Sometimes, something as small as an accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress. EOS 0 0 8 Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things.. I personally believe that it is a useful tool, depression runs deep and anxiety pushes it over the edge with deadlines. Life and Personal are very complicated situations. As is living, in itself. Small accomplishments, maybe with minor rewards to yourself as you go, boosts confidence and tends to fade out the overwhelming heavy feelings. EOS 0 0 10 What do you consider to be a minor reward that would be a good tool for me today? I have created a list and was able to check one thing off already. This has helped some and I feel a little more relieved.. EOS 0 1 11 [Providing Suggestions or Information] A punch card. If you have one handy, a note card/ index card. Draw maybe, 15 circles around the edge, and call it" My rewards" In the middle, choose one thing you enjoy, for instance, if you like an ice cream sundae, put that in the middle. For your first task, just jot all that is on your mind down, and also use that as the first task to yourself. Check off one circle, and once you hit 15 get that sundae!. Awesome! I am happy to hear that it has already helped a little! EOS 0 0 12 Thats a great idea. I really like that! EOS 0 1 13 [Reflection of feelings] I do sincerely hope you start feeling better, the current average life has altered greatly, and it has changed workloads and balances with great challenges.

EOS 3 1 4 [Providing Suggestions or Information] There are many therapists out there that work on a sliding scale based on your income. Some even offer free sessions. EOS 3 0 7 I think I feel this way because I feel so stuck. I can barely drag myself to the kitchen must let get motivated enough to clean it. EOS 3 1 12 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] How about starting with just doing the dishes, or wiping down the counter? EOS 3 0 13 That would be a simple goal, I could try for that, I think maybe I should make my first goal to find an online therapist with a sliding fee scale. EOS 3 1 14 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Yes i think that would be a great first step. Once you start feeling better about yourself it kind of snowballs in a good way.

EOS 5 1 2 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Boy, that' s a tough one. You' ve got to handle a problem like that pretty diplomatically. Have you talked to your co - worker, the one the boss hits on? EOS 5 0 3 I' ve tried to bring it up with her indirectly, but it' s an uncomfortable issue, you know? EOS 5 1 4 [Providing Suggestions or Information] That' s a good question, and I don' t know the answer. It depends on your HR department. Have you suggested that the co - worker talk to HR? Is there an anonymous system for filing complaints? EOS 5 0 5 No, the company hasn' t set up a system for passing along info that way. I don' t know if she has talked to HR. EOS 5 1 6 [Affirmation and Reassurance] That' s a good attitude. You want to be supportive and helpful. You sound like a good co - worker. Remember that the problem did not start with you, so you do not need to feel responsible for it. EOS 5 0 7 Thanks for your words of encouragement? EOS 5 1 8 [Providing Suggestions or Information] That' s a good question. I would show support for her and empathize with her and her situation. Do you have lunch with her? I could easily send her texts of encouragement. EOS 5 1 10 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Ok. That' s a good first step. I think you have a way forward with this. 3 1 0 [Question] Hi there, what' s going on today? EOS 3 0 1 Just dealing with alot of depression lately due to issues with a lot of things. The most of which being with my ex - gf and her pregnancy. She immediately cut me off once she gave birth, so I haven' t met or seen my child. It' s been 7 months. We were in the process of working on an agreement outside of court and since this I' ve had to work with the court to get this started but it' s been hard with COVID and not being able to meet with someone in person. EOS 3 1 2 [Question] Did you sign the birth certificate? EOS 3 0 3 No. That' s the other thing. She didn' t let me know about the birth until 2 hours after the fact. The hospital would only let one person there with her and her sister was there. I don' t know if she put someone else as the father or not. EOS 3 1 4 [Affirmation and Reassurance] That is absolutely horrible, and I can understand the reasoning behind your emotions now. You are a wonderful soul to care so deeply. You deserve to be a Father. Have you contacted any legal help? EOS 3 0 5 Thank you. I appreciate that. I' ve been in contact with the Self - Help center at the courthouse to help me with the process of getting a DNA test and getting things going on a case.. EOS 3 1 6 [Question] Ok that is one step closer to justice. When is that going to take place, and did you find out if that can be expedited? Your child is so fortunate to have you. Keep fighting to win custody, I believe in you. EOS 3 0 7 There' s been some issues with the paperwork which is part of why it' s taking a while. Once it gets fixed and approved, it should be easy from there. There' s no expediting it though I' m afraid. Thank you for that last message. It' s really encouraging. EOS 3 1 8 [Reflection of feelings] I am proud of being able to say I spoke with someone like you today. I hope the rest of the world takes notes from you. If everyone cared like this, the world would be a better place. Thank you for being you:) EOS 3 0 9 Thanks. I' m glad to have talked to you too. EOS 3 1 10 [Question] Is there anything else going on, aside from this? EOS 3 0 11 Well, aside from that, I' m pretty stressed about school too. EOS 3 1 12 [Question] What are you studying? EOS 3 0 13 Psychology. EOS 3 1 14 [Self-disclosure] I studied psychology years ago, and it is eye opening. Stick with it, and pay attention. It will absolutely help your cause in court too! EOS 3 0 15 Thanks! EOS 3 1 16 [Question] Anytime! Do you do anything for fun? Any hobbies? EOS 3 0 17 I read. I also like to play video games or listen to music. Unfortunately most of my time is spent on schoolwork and taking care of other things. But when I do find some time, I usually play a video game or do some reading. EOS 3 1 18 [Providing Suggestions or Information] What are some of your favorites? That is definitely one of my escapes. It is a very healthy way to cope and find some peace among the chaos. EOS 3 0 19 For reading, I like to read a variety of genres, like mysteries and self - help books. As for video games, I tend to play anything. Mostly, I' ve been playing to shut my brain off, so it' s games like GTAV or Call of Duty. EOS 3 1 20 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Can I make a suggestion? From a fellow psych buff, I recommend any of the Uncharted games or Assassin' s Creed games! You will melt into another world and it takes the stress away. Leaving you more energized to deal with real world problems! EOS 3 0 21 That' s a good idea. I actually just downloaded an Assassin' s Creed game. EOS 3 1 22 [Question] Great minds think alike! Is there anything else you wanted to bring up with me today? EOS 3 0 23 No. But thanks for listening to me. EOS 3 1 24 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Thank you for trusting me with your problems. I hope to have made you smile, even a little!

0 0 0 Hello I am here to discuss my anxiety over the current pandemic.. EOS 0 1 1 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Hey there! That' s a good topic to talk about. With everything that' s been going on, it' s normal to feel some anxiety. What do you think is one thing that is giving you a lot of anxiety? EOS 0 0 2 Thank you very much for your understanding. Yeah it' s tough especially with rising cases for the past two weeks or so in my city. I live in Canada and my city is pretty good so far and really low on numbers but have been seeing new cases every day for the last two weeks or so. so that adds anxiety to me when I go out and I am more on guard and paranoid. EOS 0 1 3 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I' m sorry to hear that. Similar stuff is happening where I am, and I also get anxious hearing about it. EOS 0 0 4 And we had a lock - down earlier this year and yet, with the exception of one province, every province remains operational at full speed despite lock - downs earlier, and now a lot of provinces are seeing record cases with the second wave. yeah I hope you get through this okay also and stay safe and well. EOS 0 1 5 [Question] What do you feel when you feel on guard and paranoid? Try to say some more about that if you can. Thanks, I hope the same for you. EOS 0 0 6 I go out pretty much only when I have a purpose and personal admin/ errands. I work about one or two days a week out of my home. So with the rising cases, I just feel anxious having to get out of the safety of my home. I was a lot more anxious earlier this year though. I am much more used to it at this time.. And it' s hard where everyday is the same for me and staying at home, without a change of pace like even simple walks outside, going to the gym, or going to hike or run etc. I pretty much missed out the whole year after March. My life has been on hold and I am just surprised that it' s even november now, because it feels like I am still stuck in March.. EOS 0 1 7 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Yeah, that makes sense. When this was all new, the uncertainty probably made for more anxiety. Now that we know some more about what is safe and what isn' t, maybe less so. But it doesn' t mean the anxiety is gone, of course. It' s still around in our day - to - day lives. Well said. You feel stuck. The usual things you would do now are just not available to you. EOS 0 0 8 yeah I have been adjusting to it and the cases were down and even to zero in my city for most of the last few months, but there' s definitely the start of a new community spread now.. yes correct. Plus there' s a loss of routine or motivation. I procrastinate a lot and get lost in thought or lost without thought. I don' t work out as much as I used to( inside or outside of home). I don' t eat as well and my sleep pattern is not good at all( I sleep a lot later than I should).. So I am disappointed in myself to say the least. and also feeling guilty to see myself waste my life and time this way and not being productive. EOS 0 1 9 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] I can rephrase some of this, if you don' t mind. In a way, you' re talking about activities that you may have used( gym, hikes, etc) to keep yourself in a good mood. Now that those don' t seem available, you just don' t have those opportunities to boost your mood. It makes sense that you would be feeling this way. EOS 0 0 10 now I am more used to it of course, but this summarizes how I have been feeling for most of this year.. EOS 0 1 11 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I think you explained yourself really well. Thanks for sharing how you' ve been feeling. EOS 0 0 12 yes you' re right. That' s exactly it. I think it' s going to be this way for a long time. I see other people compromising and taking the risk to go out for walks or runs, and even to the gym. I could have done that for the last few months when we had zero cases for awhile, but I didn' t want to gamble and compromise. And I still see those people as selfish when I choose to do what I think is right.. yeah no worries. It' s good that you understand and thank you for listening.. EOS 0 1 13 [Question] Do you think if you went ahead anyway to the gym or out for runs that you would feel guilty for doing them? EOS 0 0 14 We won' t know more about the mental implications and the sociological aspects of the pandemic probably until years to come.. I thought about that. EOS 0 1 15 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Yeah, and that just throws on another layer of why things are difficult right now. No one wants to feel guilty for doing things that could help themselves. EOS 0 0 16 to the gym, I certainly would. Because it' s indoors and I do feel it' s unsafe as there are many equipment that others could touch. Running I felt that way because the path that I usually run on is narrow and other people walk through it also. However, I did have second thoughts about that when the case numbers were down. But I finally decided to keep doing it and stick to all outdoor trips for essential business.. but that' s just me, and I know we all have different personalities, preferences, and tolerances of risks and acceptances, etc. EOS 0 1 17 [Question] Have you ever heard of the phrase" black or white thinking?" As in, thinking that situations or people are completely good or completely bad? Or completely doable or completely impossible? EOS 0 0 18 so in my opinion, I feel a little indignant at the people that have been going out frivolously like there' s nothing going on, to even gamble their safety and their family' s. Like I live in an apartment building, and the people around me and below me are always going out, even for the last few months. So I don' t feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else' s safety. So I just didn' t feel it was fair for them to do that when I could have done that anytime I wanted.. black and white thinking... let me think. for this pandemic, it' s pretty much black and white. EOS 0 1 19 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Yeah, I think I understand that too. I get really frustrated hearing about people hosting big parties or not wearing masks because they think it' s no big deal. They' re putting others at risk. EOS 0 0 20 Because I either go out or I don' t. I have to compromise my values and everything I worked hard to preserve for the last few months to go out, even if I put on extra protection etc. And I just rigidly refuse to compromise my values because I don' t believe it' s right. Because if I had done that, I would have done that already, and long ago. And even though it' s really hard on me.. yeah exactly. Because people are being selfish and are subjecting others to risks even if they don' t care about themselves.. but I know I am pretty extreme in my thinking.. I really love the outdoors and I go out pretty often before the pandemic.. But it' s just that my own thinking is rigid and made up about it.. But anyhow, that' s the situation in a nutshell.. EOS 0 1 21 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I think we all do black - or - white thinking to some extent. We' re wired to try and make sense of the world, and maybe our brains don' t like to spend time on nuance and grey areas. We all tend to quickly categorize things into good or bad, easy or hard, black or white. EOS 0 0 22 yeah I understand your thinking with the grey areas as well. I suppose for this case, it' s all black and white for me, no grea areas or compromises. that' s good analysis by the way. But anyhow I am good to go then. Thank you so very much for understanding and for your valuable inputs.. EOS 0 1 23 [Question] Does this time have to be a" waste" for you? With no productivity? That seems pretty extreme. EOS 0 0 24 it' s a fascinating area though, fascinating thinking. I am also curious on the social and mental implications of this in the long - run. but only time will tell. there will be so much research and books written about our times.. well I do a lot of" waste" at home. So I am quite sluggish and lazy and lost at home.. EOS 0 1 25 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Thanks for saying that! I liked talking with you, and we can wrap this up. I guess I' m saying you sound thoughtful and intelligent, I' m confident that you could find ways to get more out of this time if that' s what you' re wanting to do.

0 0 0 Hello I am here to discuss my anxiety over the current pandemic.. EOS 0 1 1 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Hey there! That' s a good topic to talk about. Yeah it' s tough especially with rising cases for the past two weeks or so in my city. I live in Canada and my city is pretty good so far and really low on numbers but have been seeing new cases every day for the last two weeks or so. so that adds anxiety to me when I go out and I am more on guard and paranoid. EOS 0 1 3 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I' m sorry to hear that. Similar stuff is happening where I am, and I also get anxious hearing about it. EOS 0 0 4 And we had a lock - down earlier this year and yet, with the exception of one province, every province remains operational at full speed despite lock - downs earlier, and now a lot of provinces are seeing record cases with the second wave. yeah I hope you get through this okay also and stay safe and well. EOS 0 1 5 [Question] What do you feel when you feel on guard and paranoid? Try to say some more about that if you can. Thanks, I hope the same for you. EOS 0 0 6 I go out pretty much only when I have a purpose and personal admin/ errands. I work about one or two days a week out of my home. So with the rising cases, I just feel anxious having to get out of the safety of my home. I was a lot more anxious earlier this year though. I am much more used to it at this time.. And it' s hard where everyday is the same for me and staying at home, without a change of pace like even simple walks outside, going to the gym, or going to hike or run etc. I pretty much missed out the whole year after March. My life has been on hold and I am just surprised that it' s even november now, because it feels like I am still stuck in March.. EOS 0 1 7 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Yeah, that makes sense. When this was all new, the uncertainty probably made for more anxiety. Now that we know some more about what is safe and what isn' t, maybe less so. But it doesn' t mean the anxiety is gone, of course. It' s still around in our day - to - day lives. Well said. You feel stuck. The usual things you would do now are just not available to you. EOS 0 0 8 yeah I have been adjusting to it and the cases were down and even to zero in my city for most of the last few months, but there' s definitely the start of a new community spread now.. yes correct. Plus there' s a loss of routine or motivation. I procrastinate a lot and get lost in thought or lost without thought. I don' t work out as much as I used to( inside or outside of home). I don' t eat as well and my sleep pattern is not good at all( I sleep a lot later than I should).. So I am disappointed in myself to say the least. and also feeling guilty to see myself waste my life and time this way and not being productive. EOS 0 1 9 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] I can rephrase some of this, if you don' t mind. In a way, you' re talking about activities that you may have used( gym, hikes, etc) to keep yourself in a good mood. Now that those don' t seem available, you just don' t have those opportunities to boost your mood. It makes sense that you would be feeling this way. EOS 0 0 10 now I am more used to it of course, but this summarizes how I have been feeling for most of this year.. EOS 0 1 11 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I think you explained yourself really well. Thanks for sharing how you' ve been feeling. EOS 0 0 12 yes you' re right. That' s exactly it. I think it' s going to be this way for a long time. I see other people compromising and taking the risk to go out for walks or runs, and even to the gym. I could have done that for the last few months when we had zero cases for awhile, but I didn' t want to gamble and compromise. And I still see those people as selfish when I choose to do what I think is right.. yeah no worries. It' s good that you understand and thank you for listening.. EOS 0 1 13 [Question] Do you think if you went ahead anyway to the gym or out for runs that you would feel guilty for doing them? EOS 0 0 14 We won' t know more about the mental implications and the sociological aspects of the pandemic probably until years to come.. I thought about that. EOS 0 1 15 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Yeah, and that just throws on another layer of why things are difficult right now. No one wants to feel guilty for doing things that could help themselves. EOS 0 0 16 to the gym, I certainly would. Because it' s indoors and I do feel it' s unsafe as there are many equipment that others could touch. Running I felt that way because the path that I usually run on is narrow and other people walk through it also. However, I did have second thoughts about that when the case numbers were down. But I finally decided to keep doing it and stick to all outdoor trips for essential business.. but that' s just me, and I know we all have different personalities, preferences, and tolerances of risks and acceptances, etc. EOS 0 1 17 [Question] Have you ever heard of the phrase" black or white thinking?" As in, thinking that situations or people are completely good or completely bad? Or completely doable or completely impossible? EOS 0 0 18 so in my opinion, I feel a little indignant at the people that have been going out frivolously like there' s nothing going on, to even gamble their safety and their family' s. Like I live in an apartment building, and the people around me and below me are always going out, even for the last few months. So I don' t feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else' s safety. So I just didn' t feel it was fair for them to do that when I could have done that anytime I wanted.. black and white thinking... let me think. for this pandemic, it' s pretty much black and white. EOS 0 1 19 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Yeah, I think I understand that too. I get really frustrated hearing about people hosting big parties or not wearing masks because they think it' s no big deal. They' re putting others at risk. EOS 0 0 20 Because I either go out or I don' t. I have to compromise my values and everything I worked hard to preserve for the last few months to go out, even if I put on extra protection etc. And I just rigidly refuse to compromise my values because I don' t believe it' s right. Because if I had done that, I would have done that already, and long ago. And even though it' s really hard on me.. yeah exactly. Because people are being selfish and are subjecting others to risks even if they don' t care about themselves.. but I know I am pretty extreme in my thinking.. I really love the outdoors and I go out pretty often before the pandemic.. But it' s just that my own thinking is rigid and made up about it.. But anyhow, that' s the situation in a nutshell.. EOS 0 1 21 [Providing Suggestions or Information] I think we all do black - or - white thinking to some extent. We' re wired to try and make sense of the world, and maybe our brains don' t like to spend time on nuance and grey areas. We all tend to quickly categorize things into good or bad, easy or hard, black or white. EOS 0 0 22 yeah I understand your thinking with the grey areas as well. I suppose for this case, it' s all black and white for me, no grea areas or compromises. that' s good analysis by the way. But anyhow I am good to go then. Thank you so very much for understanding and for your valuable inputs.. EOS 0 1 23 [Question] Does this time have to be a" waste" for you? With no productivity? That seems pretty extreme. EOS 0 0 24 it' s a fascinating area though, fascinating thinking. I am also curious on the social and mental implications of this in the long - run. but only time will tell. there will be so much research and books written about our times.. well I do a lot of" waste" at home. So I am quite sluggish and lazy and lost at home.. EOS 0 1 25 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Thanks for saying that! I liked talking with you, and we can wrap this up. I guess I' m saying you sound thoughtful and intelligent, I' m confident that you could find ways to get more out of this time if that' s what you' re wanting to do. EOS 0 0 26 I am productive but not as driven or productive as before at home. for sure yeah. I am sure we can get through all this in one piece eventually. I was thinking this also that even though this is a very tough time, we will look back on this about years from now, and say wow, we got through all that! EOS 0 1 27 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Not as productive? Of course! It' s a pandemic. We all are.:) Hope you' re not too hard on yourself right now.

You take care of factors under your control - wearing a mask, social distancing when outside and washing/ sanitizing hands whenever you can. 3 0 0 Hello. Anyone there? EOS 3 1 1 [Question] Hello there. How are you doing today? EOS 3 0 2 Oh hello. I' m doing okay. How are you? I feel as though there is nothing to live for and I will never be happy. EOS 3 1 5 [Reflection of feelings] I am so sorry to hear that. I understand, things can be tough sometimes. EOS 3 0 6 I don' t know how to be happy. What do I do. Ok. EOS 3 1 7 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Have you reached out to people who may be feeling the same? I know that has helped me when I have felt down. It is not easy, I know, but sometimes taking a small step can make all the difference. EOS 3 0 8 I don' t like to bother people who are feeling the same way. I don' t want to be a burden on them. EOS 3 1 9 [Question] I understand. Do you want to tell me more about what has been on your mind? EOS 3 0 10 Sure. Everyday feels pointless. I wake up, do nothing, go back to sleep. Even when I do things it still feels pointless. EOS 3 1 11 [Self-disclosure] I really do understand. It is very strong and brave of you to speak up. I have suffered depression myself in the past and one thing that truly helped was going to see my doctor and talking it though with him. He suggested medication and after some trial and error I found one that worked. You must be so strong to have dealt with the way you are feeling for so long. Please know there is help out there. I know from experience. You are a person of worth.

0 0 0 Hi, how are you? EOS 0 1 1 [Question] Hello there, how are you doing today? EOS 0 0 2 I' m ok. To be honest, I' m a therapist and I' m getting burned out on the job. EOS 0 1 9 [Question] Are you in a financial position where you could take some time off, go travelling perhaps, and renew yourself? EOS 0 0 10 I' ve thought about that. I' d love to travel. EOS 0 1 11 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Well, I would hope that they would understand that even therapists have to have a private life. And I am sure they' d prefer you at the peak of your game and not burned out. EOS 0 0 12 True. They might wonder how committed I am to them and to the profession if I go away for a while. EOS 0 0 14 Money not really the issue. I just worry that I' ll keep burning out, just more slowly. Other therapists go through this as well.. EOS 0 1 17 [Providing Suggestions or Information] lol. It' s an interesting mental picture. I am glad you still have a sense of humour though. Yeah - try and take up a new hobby with the extra time, maybe? EOS 0 0 18 Try to. Humor is a defense mechanism and coping mechanism. I have hobbies. They seem less fun because my job is less fun. 4 0 0 hello. EOS 4 1 1 [Question] Hi! How are you this evening? EOS 4 0 2 pretty depressed all in all. I dont know how to get out of this slump. EOS 4 1 3 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] Sorry to hear that. How long have you been in a slump? EOS 4 0 4 Quite a while, of course it really got worse once the pandemic hit. I am in a pretty bad marriage he is not supportive in any way. It' s getting worse instead of better. I suppose I used to be able to distract myself with the outside world and right now I cant. EOS 4 1 5 [Affirmation and Reassurance] I can understand that. It' s been hard on a lot of people. Sometimes marriages need a bit of help during tough times, have you considered a counselor? EOS 4 0 6 I have tried, he won' t go again. We have before and it didn' t really help. He argued with her. EOS 4 1 7 [Self-disclosure] My husband and I have gone a few times and it really helped having an objective person give us a few tips. We learned a lot even in just a few short months. We set goals, achieved them and then years passed and went again. That' s too bad that he won' t go again. I would still go for yourself. I have gone by myself because I needed extra help. And it' s hard to deal with someone who doesn' t want to grow and change. EOS 4 0 8 I am happy it worked for you:) I just dont see it working with us. Hes pretty stubborn. I also struggle with a severe auto immune disorder so that is always weighing on me as well. EOS 4 1 9 [Self-disclosure] I had an auto immune disorder too, actually, the counseling helped that a lot. Emotions have a way of wreaking havoc on our bodies. And it sounds like life has been stressful for you lately. Having a physical problem is really hard to deal with in addition to problems in marriage. Do you have any goals set? EOS 4 0 10 Yes, stress is terrible for chronic illness. I had goals to get back in check with myself, I' ve been worried about everyone else for so long and not really about me. The pandemic haulted a lot of that. I used to take rides and go out and enjoy nature or something simple by myself to rejuvinate but it' s harder now being worried to be around people. I also have an 8 and 1 year old. While they are my world, it' s taxing having littles depend on you 24/ 7 without a breather:) EOS 4 1 11 [Reflection of feelings] It sounds like you have a full plate with the little one. I know a lot of people are fearful now, but rest assured, children are really resilient to disease. The CDC has not even one record of a healthy child dying. Can you still go to the park and let them run and play? I think it' s healthier to be around people then to isolate. That' s my personal observation. It' s really taking a toll on all of us emotionally to be distant. little ones... EOS 4 0 12 For a few months I eased up and let them play at the park, but we live in MI which is having another huge spike, especially our county. Thank goodness we have a pretty large yard for them to run and play in but I also know its not the same. EOS 4 1 13 [Self-disclosure] One thing that comes to mind about your marriage is how I continued to work on myself, and surprisingly, some of the changes I made in myself helped my husband change. For example. I realized I didn' t speak respectfully to him all the time. So I changed my tone. Sometimes I didn' t FEEL respectful, but I read this book explaining how men really need that. So I changed me. And you know what, he really responded well to that. Became more kind and loving. I prayed a lot and that is one thing God showed me. I read a few books on what men were like and how I could help my marriage. My husband often oblivious, but when I worked on me and doing things that men like, he actually became a better man. Hard to explain. I would encourage you to write out some goals and things you want to change about yourself, ideas for you and your children to do. And fight the blues as hard as you can. I find that if I have a list of things I need to do, I can follow that even when I don' t feel like it, and sometimes I get out of the slump. EOS 4 0 14 It makes total sense. I have tried to do some research and yes work on myself as well. I have done a ton of praying. I do need to make new goals. They help me stay on track, thats for sure. Of course now that I' m home schooling my oldest I' m tearing my hair out there as welll. lol! I always had a huge amount of respect for teachers, but wow! EOS 4 1 15 [Affirmation and Reassurance] It sounds like you do know good things to do, and that sometimes you need that encouragement and and support. Do you have friends maybe to check in with? Just to chat. I have been doing that myself. Just phoning people to connect. It has helped so much. Just to say hi and share my life. Life has a way of handing us curveballs. It upsets us then we don' t know what to do, we fall down and get in a slump. And I find that writing lists, making goals, calling friends, doing things differently, brainstorming solutions can help me get back on track. EOS 4 0 16 I need to do that more! When my maternal grandma passed away in 2013 I kind of fell away from just calling people up. She was my go to person to call, always. She and my grandpa raised me and its been hard to pick up a phone knowing I cannot call her. Sounds weird I know. EOS 4 1 17 [Affirmation and Reassurance] It is NOT weird. I' m like a granma to you! hahaha I' m almost 60. We need people in our lives, older, younger, all ages. We all learn from each other. Perhaps call and aunt and check in with them. Sometimes it makes us feel better to reach out and encourage others.

0 0 0 Hello. EOS 0 1 1 [Question] Hello, how are you doing? EOS 0 0 2 I have been better. I am really stressed and feel like I am at a breaking point.. EOS 0 1 3 [Restatement or Paraphrasing] I am sorry to hear you are near your breaking point, do you have any idea when the decline and stress began? EOS 0 0 4 It began a few weeks ago. I have had a really intense project that is on a time crunch. I feel like I am overwhelmed and unable to balance work and personal life. EOS 0 1 5 [Affirmation and Reassurance] Work and personal life are very hard to juggle with each other, especially in the current life situations around the globe. I am sure you will successfully handle both in the overall. EOS 0 0 6 What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up. EOS 0 1 7 [Self-disclosure] For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to" debrief" my mind, and" declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue. Sometimes, something as small as an accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress. EOS 0 0 8 Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things.. EOS 0 1 9 [Providing Suggestions or Information] When you visually see your success, I hope it will help like it does for myself. I personally believe that it is a useful tool, depression runs deep and anxiety pushes it over the edge with deadlines. Life and Personal are very complicated situations. As is living, in itself. Small accomplishments, maybe with minor rewards to yourself as you go, boosts confidence and tends to fade out the overwhelming heavy feelings. EOS 0 0 10 What do you consider to be a minor reward that would be a good tool for me today? I have created a list and was able to check one thing off already. This has helped some and I feel a little more relieved.. EOS 0 1 11 [Providing Suggestions or Information] A punch card. If you have one handy, a note card/ index card. Draw maybe, 15 circles around the edge, and call it" My rewards" In the middle, choose one thing you enjoy, for instance, if you like an ice cream sundae, put that in the middle. For your first task, just jot all that is on your mind down, and also use that as the first task to yourself. Check off one circle, and once you hit 15 get that sundae!. Awesome! I am happy to hear that it has already helped a little!

5 1 0 [Greeting] Hi, how are you today? EOS 5 0 1 I' m doing fine. My proble m is that my boss keeps hitting on a co - worker, who really doesn' t like the guy. What can I do to make it stop? EOS 5 1 2 [Providing Suggestions or Information] Boy, that' s a tough one. You' ve got to handle a problem like that pretty diplomatically. Have you talked to your co - worker, the one the boss hits on? EOS 5 0 3 I' ve tried to bring it up with her indirectly, but it' s an uncomfortable issue, you know?
